com.itko.lisa.stats

Interface MetricIntegration

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NamedType

    public interface MetricIntegration
extends NamedType
    How the LISA stats panel learns about and uses Metrics. Their needs to be something in between the MetricCollector object and the MetricsPanel that tells it some things: - that it exists - its name (like LISA Test Metrics, SNMP) - its default set of metrics, if any - how to add one (and the UI to do so if needed) This interface gives MetricCollector authors the ability to provide these services to the MetricsPanel.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MetricCollector[] addNewCollectors(java.awt.Component par)
      This is the method used by the MetricsPanel UI when the user asks to add a Metric of your type.
      java.util.List getDefaultMetrics()
      If there are a set of metrics that should be shown in the metrics tracked table every time, then this would be how you provide that list.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.itko.lisa.test.NamedType

        getTypeName

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultMetrics

        java.util.List getDefaultMetrics()
        If there are a set of metrics that should be shown in the metrics tracked table every time, then this would be how you provide that list. For example, the LISA metrics will add everything from the TestRunInfo. SNMP really can't add anything, b/c it needs a host name and other things

      • addNewCollectors

        MetricCollector[] addNewCollectors(java.awt.Component par)
        This is the method used by the MetricsPanel UI when the user asks to add a Metric of your type. If you need to, put up a modal dialog box to ask for parameters, then construct your MetricCollector (decendant) and return it here.
        Parameters:
        par - the Parent Component (could be anything!) that wants you to do your thing
        Returns:
        a MetricCollector that the users wanted to add, or null if an error or cancel occured
